docs.snippet: SAN FRANCISCO, July 2 -- A significant step toward obtaining world-wide guarantees of the right of workers and employers to organize, with protection against dissolution of their organizations by governmental edict, was taken here this evening at the...
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO, July 2 -- A significant step toward obtaining world-wide guarantees of the right of workers and employers to organize, with protection against dissolution of their organizations by governmental edict, was taken here this evening at the thirtyfirst session of the International Labor Conference.
docs.abstract: delegates from India, Greece and Argentina seated; Jouhaux and H Altman urge return of good-will; new governing body set-up voted; workers and employers delegate groups elect reprs; list

headline.main: BROAD GUARANTEES IN ILO AGREEMENT; Conference Defines Freedom of Association of Workers and Employers in World

docs.snippet: Export collections paid by Latin America as a whole during June were the slowest for any month since May of 1947, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday. According to its latest export credit figures, supplied by twelve large New...
docs.lead_paragraph: Export collections paid by Latin America as a whole during June were the slowest for any month since May of 1947, the Federal Reserve Bank of New York reported yesterday. According to its latest export credit figures, supplied by twelve large New York banks, these collections have been progressively slower since February, the Federal Reserve said.
docs.abstract: NY Fed Reserve Bank rept on NYC bank collections, Latin Amer, June

headline.main: PAYMENTS SLOWED BY LATIN AMERICA; Federal Reserve Bank Reports June Export Collections Lowest Since May, 1947

docs.snippet: The dominant note of the business in the foreign exchange market last week was the marked strength of the far forward positions of the pound sterling. Demand was forceful enough to revive interest in the six and nine months' contracts which had not...
docs.lead_paragraph: The dominant note of the business in the foreign exchange market last week was the marked strength of the far forward positions of the pound sterling. Demand was forceful enough to revive interest in the six and nine months' contracts which had not been a part of recent trading. Observers attributed this to recent developments affecting the pound which have brought about an altered perspective so far as devaluation of that unit is concerned.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; Week Ended July 16, 1948

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON. July 19 (AP) -The National Petroleum Council reported today that the United States now owns 42.9 per cent of the world's oil tankers.
